      • signed

        public boolean signed()
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        Once a message is signed it can't be modified, only read.

        It cannot be sent until it is signed.

        Specified by:
        signed in interface SignedMessage
        Returns:
        true if signed, false if not signed

        public long address()
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        Unique address for the sender. This should be the last 8 bytes of the public key.
        Specified by:
        address in interface SignedMessage
        Returns:
        a unique id for this server.

      • timestampUS

        public long timestampUS()
        Description copied from interface: SignedMessage
        A microsecond precision, unique timestamp

        NOTE: If the writing system doesn't have a micro-second accurate clock, the most accurate clock should be used and increment the timestamp in the cause of any collision

        Specified by:
        timestampUS in interface SignedMessage
        Returns:
        a unique microsecond timestamp for an address. Must be monotonically increasing.
